classic.name: Brandenburg Gate
classic.description: Restored 18th-century gate & landmark with 12 Doric columns topped by a classical goddess statue.

classic.name: Reichstag Building
classic.description: Neo-Renaissance parliament building topped by a Norman Foster glass dome with 360-degree city views.

classic.name: German Museum of Technology
classic.description: Transport & technological museum with an airplane on the roof, set in a green park with windmills.

classic.name: East Side Gallery
classic.description: Conserved graffiti project by 118 artists covering part of the Berlin Wall & celebrating its demise.

classic.name: Olympiastadion Berlin
classic.description: Sporting arena, built for the 1936 Olympics, with 74,649 seats, a soccer pitch & an athletics track.

classic.name: Berlin Cathedral
classic.description: Majestic 1800s cathedral with an organ with 7,269 pipes, plus royal tombs & a dome for city views.

classic.name: Charlottenburg Palace
classic.description: Baroque summer palace with huge gardens & rooms packed with paintings, tapestries & porcelain.

classic.name: Berlin Wall Memorial
classic.description: Commemorative stretch of the historic divide with a preserved section of original wall & memorial.

classic.name: New National Gallery
classic.description: European & American 20th-century masterpieces on display in a Mies van der Rohe-designed museum.

classic.name: Topography of Terror

classic.description: 67m-high gilded column commemorating victory in the Prussian-Danish war, with a deck for city views.

classic.name: Tiergarten
classic.description: Berlin's largest & oldest park, including family amenities, walking paths & a victory column.

classic.name: Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe
